images.caption: Lyn-J Dixon had 104 carries for 635 yards and six touchdowns with Clemson in 2019, but has totaled only 52 carries for 238 yards in two years since.

images.caption: Senior Kai-Leon Herbert was the No. 99 prospect in the 2017 class. He opted out of the 2020 season and has mainly been a reserve for Miami.

articles.description: After four seasons at Northwestern, quarterback Hunter Johnson is transferring back to Clemson -- a rare transfer to Dabo Swinney's program.
articles.headline: Onetime Clemson football recruit QB Hunter Johnson transfers back to Tigers after career at Northwestern

article.description: David Howerton blocked a punt and recovered it in the end zone for a score to give Wofford enough of a margin to hold off Mercer 31-21 on Saturday.
article.headline: Howerton's defensive TD helps Wofford beat Mercer 31-21
article.linkText: Howerton's defensive TD helps Wofford beat Mercer 31-21
article.story: SPARTANBURG, S.C. -- David Howerton blocked a punt and recovered it in the end zone for a score to give Wofford enough of a margin to hold off Mercer 31-21 on Saturday. Howerton broke through to get to the punter with 11:19 left in the third to give Wofford a 21-7 lead. David Marvin added a 33-yard field goal to go up 24-7. The Bears answered when John Russ hit Marquise Irvin from the 10 for a touchdown with 3:42 left in the third. Irvin set a school record for number of catches in a game, pulling in 12 for 143 yards and two scores. Russ hit Irvin on another 10-yard scoring play to close to within 10 with 6:03 left in the game. Lorenzo Long rushed for 108 yards and two touchdowns for Wofford (5-3, 3-2 Southern Conference). Russ led Mercer (4-4, 2-3), throwing for 271 yards and three scores.
